text: Jean Rémusat (1815–1880) was a French flautist, composer of music for the flute, and conductor. In later life he lived in Shanghai. ==Life== Rémusat was born in Bordeaux in 1815. From 1830 he studied at the Paris Conservatoire with flautist Jean-Louis Tulou, in 1832 winning first prize. He moved to London, where he was first flute at the Queen's Theatre. The theatre closed in 1853, and he returned to Paris, playing solo flute at the Théâtre Lyrique."Remusat, Jean" Grande Musica. Retrieved 26 August 2019.Europas konstnärer ("Europe's Artists") (1887), page 475 Project Runeberg. About 1865, Rémusat moved to Shanghai. He founded the Shanghai Philharmonic Society; in 1879 he was appointed the first conductor of the Shanghai Public Band, which later became the Shanghai Symphony Orchestra."The Shanghai Symphony Orchestra" Akademie- und Konzertbüro Richter. Retrieved 26 August 2019."Three Dynasties Make One Orchestra" Interlude.hk, 6 May 2019. Retrieved 26 August 2019. Rémusat died in Shanghai in 1880. ==Compositions== He composed music for the flute, duets for flutes, and for flute and violin, and operatic transcriptions. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1815 births Category:1880 deaths Category:French classical flautists Category:People from Bordeaux Category:Musicians from Shanghai Category:Conservatoire de Paris alumni
title: Jean Rémusat
